Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior reserved with single black band; exterior glazed; underside reserved; inscription on underside.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B2
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, but the profile finds parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9A. The type closely follows the shape and decoration of the Attic Plain Komast cups. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type B2 (Vallet and Villard 1964, 67-68). Furthermore, the fabric and pattern find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type VIII (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111- 116). Hayes' Type VIII is of the same shape as his Type IX (only the interior decoration is different) which coincides with Schlotzhauer's (Schlotzhauer 2012) Type 9a. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus and the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 595)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.452) (Phase 3)
